file_content.text: Everywhere except the Republic, that is. Imprisoning Saresh hasn't done us any favors there.
Saresh was a popular leader. They need time to accept the truth about her.
We'll win them back.
Imperial recruits have more than made up for the shortfall.
Acina is making good on her promises to the Alliance.
Acina's people seem determined to serve you, treaty or no.
She committed acts of treason. She belongs in a cell.
Saresh earned her prison.
Acina offered to put Saresh in a tomb on Korriban. I said we'd consider it.
I don't trust the Republic. When Zakuul falls, we'll turn our attention to Coruscant.
Forget the Republic.
Glad you're planning for the future, but I suspect we'll have no shortage of enemies.
The ship is dry docked while we finish the upgrades, but Tora and Hylo have already formed a replacement crew.
Did Tora shed any tears over her former captain's execution? I don't need any more traitors.
They'd better be trustworthy.
Tora's under surveillance. You needn't worry. She's loyal.
If Koth knows what's good for him, he's already far away from here.
I hope Koth is long gone.
I put him aboard a shuttle bound for the opposite side of the galaxy. You won't see him again.
The ship will remain dry docked until the upgrades are complete. It'll be some time before it's ready for action.
Put every available resource into the Gravestone. It's still our best weapon against Vaylin.
Get the Gravestone ready fast.
Funny, I thought you were. I'll add more repair crews to the ship.
I was hoping we'd find a second Gravestone on Iokath. What would it take to build more ships like it?
We need to build more like it.
We don't have those kinds of resources... yet.
Our scouts report Iokath's radiation levels are still dangerously high. They disrupt navigation... comm signals. We can't get close enough to explore.
But there's no sign Vaylin has any interest in returning to Iokath.
She won't risk another confrontation with me.
She'll avoid it.
The advanced weapons may some day prove irresistible.
If anyone else attempts to claim that world, kill them.
Iokath will be mine.
I declared the entire system off-limits. No one wants to risk a fight with you.
And we've seen nothing of SCORPIO, assuming she did merge with Iokath.
I think we've seen the last of her. When we parted ways, she seemed almost happy.
Let's hope she did.
It's more than she deserves.
We've barely scratched the surface of that world. Alert me the moment it's safe to return.
Keep me posted.
You'll be the first to know.
I already regret letting her go. Who knows what she'll do with the planet.
I should've destroyed her.
Let's hope she was sincere about withdrawing from the galaxy.
My operatives have hunted Arcann since he fled Voss. The trail went cold on Nar Shaddaa. We believe he acquired extensive cybernetic enhancements there.
Spread the word that I'm willing to accept his surrender. See if it flushes him out.
Try to take him alive.
He never struck me as the surrendering type.
Senya's plan to heal him failed. He's rebuilt himself the hard way.
He's gotten desperate.
His upgrades were especially painful. That may explain why he hasn't resurfaced.
He'll never make himself strong enough to survive me.
Enhancements won't save him.
Vaylin is chasing him, too. He's running out of places to hide.
There's been no change in Senya's condition. The doctors have done all they can. The rest is up to her.
Senya deserves to live. She sacrificed everything for her son.
Let's hope she pulls through.
She believes in Arcann's redemption, but so far he hasn't done anything to prove her right.
What have we learned about Arcann?
Any news on her son?
My agents followed his trail from Tython to Dantooine, but it went cold after Nar Shaddaa.
Senya made her choice. She'll either live with the consequences, or not.
If Senya dies, so be it.
I'll have the medical droids offer only minimal care. No heroic measures.
Alliance Intelligence won't stop hunting Arcann. We will find him.
Despite all we've endured, we're stronger than ever.
Do not surrender to self-delusion. If not for my conditioning, Vaylin would rain death upon this world. You are strong, but you are never safe.
I need a fleet that obeys my commands without question. Give it to me.
Connecting to GEMINI frequency. Resetting all units to default programming.
Reset complete. Awaiting input.
Vessel 9947, destroy vessel 3265.
Everything is so much better when we know our place.
Good news, Commander. Alliance recruitment has increased dramatically.
Everywhere except the Republic, of course. Executing Saresh wasn't well-received there.
She was too dangerous to keep alive. If protecting the Alliance means losing Republic support, so be it.
Saresh had to die.
I'm sure our treaty with Acina didn't help.
In retrospect, Acina's treaty might've been useful.
Too bad we didn't give Saresh to Acina before rejecting the treaty. Would've been simpler.
Our treaty with Acina raised more than a few eyebrows.
Acina didn't appreciate when you snubbed her treaty.
Just before we escaped Iokath, SCORPIO sent technical readouts to us. We're using them to enhance the Gravestone.
It's her farewell gift.
I've collated every datafile recovered on Iokath. Some of the technical readouts could enhance the Gravestone.
We need every advantage.
Regardless, we have no way of knowing when Iokath will be safe to explore again. When that changes, you'll be the first to know.
That covers personnel. On to materiel.
Good news, Commander.
I've been meaning to ask: How did you defeat Vaylin aboard the Gravestone?
I didn't. Valkorion triggered conditioning buried deep in Vaylin's mind. She wanted to strike me down, but she couldn't.
I see. That must be agonizing for Vaylin, but it's good news for the Alliance.
